pullRequest.title: [RW-3062][risk=no] Fix "Aou" and "All of Us" text across workbench
pullRequest.bodyText:
Make sure all instances of 'AoU' and 'All of Us' are spelled out and italicized
*Note: The 'All of Us' in account-creation-options.tsx is left unitalicized since it needs to be a string as the label for the dropdown option

PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 I have run and tested this change locally

commit.message: RW-3062 fix non-italicized All of Us text
RW-3062 spell out and italicize AoU text

nodes.bodyText: [no action needed] I've used React.ReactNode for type-annotating in similar scenarios (code). This seems maybe more specific / appropriate, but React.ReactNode may make it possible to avoid wrapping plain-text descriptions in  elements to satisfy the type-checker. Either way, we should probably aim to eventually make our type usage consistent here, and/or clarify when to use one vs. the other.

commit.message: RW-3062 switch registration task descriptions to type React.ReactNode
